hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Volatility Compression Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes (confidence 55-70%), when BTC experiences a volatility breakout (price moves >1.5x the 20-day ATR) on low volume (<80% of 20-day average volume), fading the initial breakout direction will be profitable as the move lacks conviction and tends to reverse.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes, low-volume breakouts often represent liquidity grabs or stop-loss runs rather than sustainable trend changes. Fading these moves capitalizes on the market's tendency to revert to the established range.
entry_conditions: BTC price moves >1.5x its 20-day ATR in a single day
Breakout day volume < 80% of 20-day average volume
Open interest increases by <5% on breakout day

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the breakout move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price continues in breakout direction by another 1x ATR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If low-volume breakouts in neutral regimes consistently continue in the same direction (>1x ATR beyond entry), the hypothesis is falsified.
